entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, Harry is described as relieving an owl of its burden and receiving a present on his birthday.

entities.name: errol
entities.description: Errol is Harry's owl, which delivers a package to him. The text describes Errol as 'ruﬄing its feathers importantly' and taking off through the window.

entities.name: arthur weasley
entities.description: Arthur Weasley is a Ministry of Magic employee who has won the Daily Prophet Grand Prize Galleon Draw. He is described as 'delighted' and planning to spend the gold on a summer holiday in Egypt.

entities.name: ministry of magic
entities.description: The Ministry of Magic is mentioned as the workplace of Arthur Weasley. The text describes it as having an 'Oﬀice' and a 'Grand Prize Galleon Draw'.

entities.name: daily prophet
entities.description: The Daily Prophet is mentioned as the newspaper that published the article about Arthur Weasley's win. The text describes it as having a 'Grand Prize Galleon Draw' and featuring moving pictures.

entities.name: egypt
entities.description: Egypt is mentioned as the destination of Arthur Weasley's summer holiday, which he plans to spend with his winnings from the Daily Prophet Grand Prize Galleon Draw.

relationships.description: The text describes Harry as relieving Errol of its burden, indicating that Harry owns or possesses Errol.
Arthur Weasley is described as the 'Head of the Misuse of Muggle Artifacts Oﬀice at the Ministry of Magic', indicating that he works for or is an employee of the Ministry.
Arthur Weasley has won the Daily Prophet Grand Prize Galleon Draw, indicating that he is a winner of the newspaper's contest.
Arthur Weasley plans to spend his winnings on a summer holiday in Egypt, indicating that he is planning to visit or travel to Egypt.
